section.note: In the samples below, :SRID indicates the optional spatial reference identifier argument. For MySQL, the default is 4326.

section.title: Creating and Dropping Tables with Geometry Columns

case.title: Creating
case.example: CREATE TABLE GeogTest ( KeyValue varchar(25) NOT NULL, Location GEOMETRY NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (KeyValue)) ENGINE = InnoDB

case.title: Portable
case.example: INSERT INTO GeogTest (KeyValue, Location) values('Item1', GeogCreateLocation(-70, 42, :SRID))

case.title: Native
case.example: INSERT INTO GeogTest (KeyValue, Location) VALUES ('Item1', PointFromText(CONCAT('POINT(', CAST( - 70 as CHAR(32)), ' ', CAST(42 as CHAR(32)), ')'), :SRID))

case.title: Portable
case.example: INSERT INTO GeogTest (KeyValue, Location) values('Item2', GeogCreateLine(-70, 42, -70, 38, :SRID))

case.title: Native
case.example: INSERT INTO GeogTest (KeyValue, Location) VALUES ('Item2', LineStringFromText(CONCAT('LINESTRING(', CAST( - 70 as CHAR(32)), ' ' , CAST(42 as CHAR(32)), ', ', CAST( - 70 as CHAR(32)), ' ' , CAST(38 as CHAR(32)), ')'),:SRID))

case.title: Portable
case.example: INSERT INTO GeogTest (KeyValue, Location) values('Item3', GeogCreatePolygon(-70, 42, -70, 32, -60, 32, -60, 42, -70, 42, :SRID))

case.title: Native
case.example: INSERT INTO GeogTest (KeyValue, Location) VALUES ('Item3', PolygonFromText( CONCAT('POLYGON((',CAST( - 70 as CHAR(32)), ' ', CAST(42 as CHAR(32)), ', ', CAST( - 70 as CHAR(32)), ' ', CAST(32 as CHAR(32)), ', ', CAST( - 60 as CHAR(32)), ' ', CAST(32 as CHAR(32)), ', ', CAST( - 60 as CHAR(32)), ' ', CAST(42 as CHAR(32)), ', ', CAST( - 70 as CHAR(32)), ' ', CAST(42 as CHAR(32)), '))'),:SRID))

see.ref: Changes to SQL Objects for Geometry
